title.narrative: Malawi Third Social Action Fund (MASAF 3) APL II (LDF Mechanism)

description.narrative: The Development Objective is to improve the livelihoods of poor households within the framework of improved Local Governance at community, Local Authority, and National levels.

condition.narrative: Based on MTR, the Recipient shall promptly prepare action plan satisfactory to IDA for implementation of the project, andimplementsuch action plan.
MOF shall establish a technical support team (TST) of experts that will be responsible for the day-to-day operations of theProject, and assist in dev. of operational procedures, etc.
No later than 30 months after the Effective Date or such other date as the Recipient and the Association shall agree upon, theRecipient and the Association shall carry out jointly a mid-term review.
The Recipient shall have its Financial Statements (FS)audited in accordance with the provisions of Section 4.09 (b) of the GeneralConditions. Each audit of the FS shall cover the period 1-fiscal yr
The Recipient shall implement the environmental and social screening process outlined in the Environmental and Social ManagementFramework including ESMP.
The Recipient shall implement the provisions of the Resettlement Policy Framework (RPF) which are designed to mitigate potentialadverse social impacts due to land acquisition for Sub-projects
The Recipient shall maintain or cause to be maintained a financial management system in accordance with the provisions of Section4.09 of the General Conditions.
The Recipient shall monitor & evaluate progress of the Project & prepare Reports in accordance with Section 4.08 - GeneralConditions no later than 45 days after end period covered by such rpt.
The Recipient shall prepare & furnish to IDA mid-term review reports in scope & detail satisfactory to IDA.
The Recipient shall: (i) adopt, no later than one month after the Effective Date, a Project Operational Manual, in form andsubstance satisfactory to the Association.
The audited Financial Statements for each such period shall be furnished to the Association not later than six months after theendof such period.
the Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the IDA as part of the Project Rpt. not later than 45 days after the end of ea.calendarquarter, interim unaudited financial reports satisfactory to IDA.

title.narrative: Percent procurement of goods and services at local authority level based on competitive bidding

comment.narrative: Baseline data not available
Baseline is from APL 1
At least 40% female
During the preparation of the AF II, the Board suggested that the team should increase female participation target to 50%, thishasbeen achieved.

title.narrative: At least 70% of local authorities able to set annual targets and achieve 70% of their annual targets.

comment.narrative: Criteria to be developed by December 31, 2009. Data collection instrument will be Public Expenditure Tracking Surveys conductedannually at the end of budget year.
70% of local authorities achieving 70% of annual targets
This is an APL III Trigger and was being monitored even though there is no APL III
No baseline
Target not set

comment.narrative: The baseline was derived from the Annual Performance Assessment carried out in 2009
60% of the Councils having unqualified audit reports

comment.narrative: This is APL I achievements
This indicator was added in 2010 the time of processing the first Additional Financing

title.narrative: PWSP beneficiaries with savings of at least 50% of PWSP wage one year after participation (of which women)

comment.narrative: This is a new indicator added during preparation of Additional Financing in June 2010, so there was no base line at projectinception in June 2008.
50% female
62% of beneficiaries are female.

comment.narrative: at beginning of Project
Due to the demand-driven nature of sub-projects, target values could not be pre-determined.
Nothing has been demanded by the communities

comment.narrative: at beginning of Project
1,000 primary school staff houses
PSSHP and CRW AF-1

title.narrative: At least 70% of the annual PWSP cycles are completed according to plan.

comment.narrative: not applicable
70% of PWSP cycles completed according to plan
This is a Trigger for APL 3

comment.narrative: The previous one should have been 1,396 ha

title.narrative: Classroom to Student ratio in intervention areas

comment.narrative: 70% of LAs publicly disclose expenditures by End of Project; 30% by MTR

title.narrative: Local Authorities meeting specified criteria in Financial Mangement: Non qualified audits
Safety Net Programs (Public works subprojects) implemented

comment.narrative: Due to the demand driven nature of the subproject, it is not possible to determine before hand the number of projects that willcome up

title.narrative: Beneficiaries paid in a timely manner: Wages paid within two weeks of works

comment.narrative: 2012 Tracking Studay

title.narrative: Person days provided in labor intensive public works
At least 70% of appraised Community Action Plans reflected in District Annual Investment Plans.
Number of beneficiaries reached under direct support
Community Savings and Investment Groups created that are reach stage 3 (after 6-9 months)

comment.narrative: Each group has 30 - 40 members per group. The figure is net of baseline
61% are held by women

title.narrative: Number of additional classrooms built or rehabilitated at the primary level resulting from project interventions.
Local Authority Capital Grants System defined and ready for implementation by MTR.

comment.narrative: Done

title.narrative: Functional Internal procurement Committee and availability of Procurement Plan
Local Authorities meeting specified criteria in Procurement (functional Internal procuremnt Committee)
Communities satisfied with support provided by the Local Assemblies, Area Development Committees, and Village Development Committees

comment.narrative: Low achievement under the PWSP due to LAs not providing other working tools such as hoes and lack of structures e.g curvets

title.narrative: PWSP Beneficiaries that were able to buy agricuktural inputs following participation in the PWSP (of which female)

comment.narrative: The crisis situation in Malawi created an environment that was beyond the control of the project. People's priorities shifted tobuying food due to the increased food insecurity at the household level, hence the under achievement.

title.narrative: At least 70% of VDCs/ ADCs are functional institutions which address service gaps at community level.

comment.narrative: 70% of ADCs/VDCs are functional institutions

title.narrative: Framework defined for Intergovernmental Fiscal Transfer System to support service delivery of LA defined and ready for testing by MTR

comment.narrative: The IGFTS was defined and is in place

title.narrative: Community level tracking system delivering information on baselines, targeting, utilization of PWSP wage earnings on an annual basis.

target.value: Annual studies completed and results available for improved targeting for next P WP cycle.

comment.narrative: Due to demand-driven nature of the Project, target values could not be pre-determined. Annual targets are set by Local Assemblies.
Currently, over 50% of public works sub-projects are rural roads.

title.narrative: People with access to improved learning environment

comment.narrative: 1000 staff houses were expected to be constructed every year but due to limited funds this has not been possible

title.narrative: Community level tracking system that delivers information on baselines, targeting, utilization of PWSP wage earnings on an annual basis defined and implemented

target.value: Tracking Studies to determine use of income implemented

comment.narrative: Based on communities that participate in the tracking studies

title.narrative: Communities with operational community level tracking System tracking system

comment.narrative: Two Annual Tracking studies undertaken in 2011 and 2012
Target not set
